Message:
Soon after Lady Elfriede took me in,
I became one of the Guardian Knights.

They were the regiment of knights
directly under her, the next Pope.

But, was it truly
acceptable for me,
a witch, to be at her side?

If that were to cause her
any trouble, I...

One day, as those worries
plagued my mind,
Lady Elfriede took me outside,
leading me to the city square.

There were so many
people there.
Some were dressed in
tattered clothes...

but there wasn’t a face
without a smile.

“I wish to protect all you see here.
But, I cannot do it alone.

So I ask, with me as
inexperienced as I am...
will you lend me your help
as one of my knights?”

Is she trying to raise
my spirits, of all things...?
Ahh, I see.

I was never a witch in her eyes—
I was always me.

The same went for the others
in the Knights of Longinus.
Rather than speak ill of me
for being a witch,
they accepted me as
one of their own.

From that day on,
I never belittled myself ever again.
